reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Political empowering of women in Palestine- From woman to woman

description.narrative: Women is Palestine are still separated from policy-making due to a set of political economic and social conditions and struggle in order to reach high authority possessions which are usually occupied by them. the project will try to rebuild trust bridges b etween men and women in addition to improve how society looks at women. The project aims at enhancing the participation of women in political parties and to build the woman capacities. The project targets 90 women who candidate in the municipality and vill age councils regardless they succeeded or not. Four main activities will be implemented under the framework of the project. The first one is to conduct training courses about the vision of political parties the civil society human rights lobbying and advo cacy and media. The second activity is to give the women who submitted to the training courses the chance to train and addressee other women from their villages and municipality councils. The third one is to raise up the voice of women in Palestine and enc ourage her to take an action by organizing an advocacy campaign related to the political situation in Palestine. And the fourth activity is recording television episodes and radio spots so as to become more involved with the others in their Community an d to expand the circle of awareness and the knowledge base throughout. Women candidates will play the main role in this project. They will be like pressure teams, they will organize lobbying campaigns to raise the women awareness regarding the electoral law importance of democracy and educate them on the qualifications and characteristics that the ideal candidate should posses. Through this project the targeted women will also be motivated to increase their participation in policy making on local level th rough participating in the local council's electoral process. We hope that this project will eventually contribute to a social change in the targeted districts were the candidates are elected because of their performance not on tribe basis.
